name: Survival and Demise of Dictatorships
description: This course will provide an introduction to theories of why some dictatorships survive while others do not. We will explore theories rooted in regime type, resources, state capacity, parties, popular protest, and leadership. We will then examine the utility of these approaches through in-depth examinations of regime crises in Ethiopia, Iran, China, the USSR, and South Africa.Area of Focus: Comparative Politics
prerequisites: POLB92H3 and [ POLB90H3 or POLB91H3] and [an additional 2.0 credits at the C-level in any courses]
